org.eng.aisp.dataset

Interface IReferencedSoundSpec

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IReferencedDataSpec<SoundRecording>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MetaData.Record, ReferencedSoundSpec

    public interface IReferencedSoundSpec
extends IReferencedDataSpec<SoundRecording>
    Extends the super class to add optional segmenting of the referenced sound. Segmentation is only intended to be done when the end offset msec is non-zero. An implementations #apply(SoundRecording) method must also apply the segmentation, if any.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getEndMsec()
      Get the end offset of this segment within the referenced segment.
      int getStartMsec()
      Get the start offset of this segment within the referenced segment.
      boolean isSubSegment()
      Determine if this spec applies to/specifies a sub-segment of the referenced sound.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eng.aisp.dataset.IReferencedDataSpec

        apply, getLabels, getReference, getTags

    • Method Detail

      • getStartMsec

        int getStartMsec()
        Get the start offset of this segment within the referenced segment.
        Returns:
        a number from 0 to 1 less than the length of the clip in msec.

      • getEndMsec

        int getEndMsec()
        Get the end offset of this segment within the referenced segment.
        Returns:
        0 there is no segmentation to be done, otherwise a number larger than the value returned by getStartMsec().

      • isSubSegment

        boolean isSubSegment()
        Determine if this spec applies to/specifies a sub-segment of the referenced sound. This is really a convenience on testing getSegmentEndMsec() > 0.
        Returns:
        true if this represents a sub-segment of the referenced sound. false if the whole referenced sound.
